name: Ramada Anaheim Maingate/At the Park

reviews.text: One thing to note, the main pedestrian entrance to Disneyland is not in front of this property. It's about 100m away on the next intersection. However the location of this hotel is very good as within that 100m to Disneyland's entrance you'd find three or four restaurants, while McD is only 50m away.
reviews.title: Totally awesome

reviews.text: We have very good service from the staff at this hotel. But I wish that they would be more knowledgeable in public transport since no one could tell me about bus routes to shopping centres. Again as in my LA hotel review, it seems that public transport rates very low in So Cal's way of life, I couldn't find any information about buses etc.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel,worth the money

reviews.text: The room is on the smaller side, but it comes with a microwave and refrigerator (at last!). Bathroom is also quite small, and the air conditioning is located on the floor and quite big, although it did a very good job is cooling the room down. We were there when the mercury was hitting 99-104 around 11am.
reviews.title: The only place I stay in Anaheim now...

reviews.text: Breakfast was adequate although the donuts weren't the best. But it saved us from looking for breakfast before going to Disneyland. One thing to remember, if you want to avoid the crowds, get in early as most people were arriving around 10, by which you'd gone on 6-7 rides.
reviews.title: Thanks Ramada!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because it's close to Disneyland we did come back to the hotel for a nap and lunch before going back to Disneyland around 4-5pm.
reviews.title: A 2 day date with my husband at the Happiest Place on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why, when you are going to have the time of your life in Disney would you consider staying in this place? Other reviews suggest that it is ideal location and that it is a great place to stay - I only agree with the location. The motel (it is not a hotel) simply looks like it is stuck in the 1960's and needs a thorough clean up and refurbishment. The rooms are small, with two beds squeezed in to accommodate families who seem to be the main customers. The rooms were also of poor quality in terms of furnishings - the bed was a sponge on wheels. The bathroom was clean and well stocked with towels etc. There was nothing pleasant about the room - it was dark, stuffy and decorated by someone with no taste.
reviews.title: Why subject yourself to this torture?

reviews.text: By far the worst aspect of the hotel is the breakfast. DO NOT BOTHER. It is a bun fight in a wee shed beside the pool. Forget about a table and chair to eat at - how about a competition to see who can capture a wee bit of wall to sit on with your disposable plate and cup perched on your knee.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: This place does not even come close to other Ramada locations. I think that if you have any standards do not stay here. if you only buy something on price and are able to accept some compromises on comfort and a good night of sleep then go here and join the rest of the mob.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay, Clean quiet Location

reviews.text: The WiFi is rubbish - it would be quicker writing your own web pages.
reviews.title: It was a excellent Stay

reviews.text: Great Hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff, and short walk to Disneyland. Would Stay again.
reviews.title: great hotel at a great value and location!

reviews.text: The perfect place to stay on your Dinseyland vacation.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel at reasonable prices
Old, smelly, 1/2 hot "mini suite", but great location!
reviews.text: *3 minute walk to Disneyland. Note that this is much closer than staying at the Disney properties.
*The front desk staff could not be more friendly and respectful.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: *The property itself was safe and clean with plenty parking.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *The room was clean. The beds were comfortable. Nice bathroom with plenty towels and amenities.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for a great price

reviews.text: We booked this room based on the TA rating and were looking for a mid range resort for our stay in Anaheim. We booked a Premier Room and stayed at this resort for 7 nights. This hotel was ok (clean) and reasonably comfortable, however is very much a motel.
reviews.title: Great Location... however forget the breakfast!

reviews.text: The resort is in a good location within a short walking distance to the Park (which made up for the average accomodation).
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, great location, even better price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast that was included in our stay was just terrible and we chose to pay for our breakfast elsewhere (it was that bad). The food was poor quality (even the bread was horrible) and the breakfast room was so small that you dreaded going in there each morning. In addition, there were virtually no tables where you could sit down and eat your breakfast and even when you find a table it was really dirty because there were no staff cleaning them.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: The pool was ok (a bit run down) and the 'heated pool' that they claim on there web site did not seem to be working (the pool was not warm).
reviews.title: Excellent service.

reviews.text: Overall, the accomodation is just average however the location made up for this (just!).
reviews.title: Convenient and budget friendly stay within very short walking distance of the Disney parks

aka: Ramada Maingate - At The Park Hotel Anaheim
description: Within Walking Distance of Disneyland. If you are searching for an accommodation near Disneyland, the Ramada Maingate At the Park is a great option. At the Ramada Maingate at the Park you’re in the heart of all the fun and excitement of the Disneyland® Resort. The accommodation is located across the street from Disneyland, so there is no need to take a shuttle. Your family’s choice for an Accommodation near Disneyland. Staying here is convenient and enjoyable for all families seeking an accommodation near Disneyland. We have made many changes that are not seen in most other Ramada locations, specifically designed to benefit parents and children. For example, we offer a poolside complimentary breakfast. There is no more perfect combination; this allows parents to eat their breakfast while children play in the pool. Rollaway beds and cribs are provided with no extra charges or limitations. Rooms feature comfortable beds designed for quality sleep. There are fridges and microwaves in each room, so you can keep snacks in the room. There is also free complimentary WiFi for visitors to enjoy surfing the web. Unwind in a room that includes all comfort. After you’ve hit all the sites and snapped all of those magical photos, you’ll find a stay at the Ramada Maingate at the Park is just what you need to unwind. With rooms as inviting as our service, we are waiting to make you feel right at home.
